title: sql.Open() does not return an error on failure ?
body:
Hey guys, I ran into something strange today.. I might be doing something wrong since it's my second day of programming in GO, but I figured I'd post this anyways. ( sorry if it is a duplicate )

1. What version of Go are you using (`go version`)?
**go version xgcc (Ubuntu 4.9.3-0ubuntu4) 4.9.3 linux/amd64**


2. What operating system and processor architecture are you using (`go env`)?
**GOARCH="amd64"
GOBIN="/home/vagrant/work/code/go-server/bin"
GOCHAR="6"
GOEXE=""
GOHOSTARCH="amd64"
GOHOSTOS="linux"
GOOS="linux"
GOPATH="/home/vagrant/work/code/go-server"
GORACE=""
GOROOT="/usr"
GOTOOLDIR="/usr/lib/gccgo/tool"
TERM="dumb"
CC="gcc"
GOGCCFLAGS="-g -O2 -fPIC -m64 -pthread"
CXX="g++"
CGO_ENABLED="1"**


3. What did you do?
Repository: **https://gitlab.com/Sve1nn/go-web-framework**
File/ Line: **https://gitlab.com/Sve1nn/go-web-framework/blob/master/sql.go#L45**
Error trigger: **when loading the root route "/"**
Description: **The sql.Open() func does NOT return any kind of error. Not when credentials are  wrong or if the SQL server is simply offline. The funny part is that it DOES require you to either set the   error or throw the error into the bit bucket ( _ )**


4. What did you expect to see?
**Some sort of database connection error.**


5. What did you see instead?
**nil / Nothing**



P.s. THANK YOU FOR GO. This language has been needed for a long time. 
P.s.s. You hiring ? :)
